text: Just finished crying, got up in the middle of the night to study. Turned on the camera and thought, oh my, who’s this cutie?

I tried using Svelte to build a small project, and it felt great. There’s no need to write separate CSS files, no hassle with props or state. useEffect and useState are almost handled implicitly for me, and there’s no unnecessary boilerplate code. Using stores is also super convenient. From now on, I’ve decided to use Svelte for all my new projects!

前几天试着用 Svelte 写了一个小项目，感觉很不错。完全不用单独写 css 文件，没有 props/state 那么麻烦的玩儿意，useEffect 和 useState 几乎是隐式地帮我完成了，没有乱七八糟的模板代码，store 用起来也很爽。暂定之后的新项目一律使用 Svelte !

My mom sent me a Douyin wedding invitation screenshot of my first crush from elementary school celebrating his wedding during this New Year. I could barely recognize who it was without seeing the name. Getting married - everyone's starting to get married. This path that was once considered the most natural course of life has now become something I completely exclude from my life plans. Looking back, I've really come a long way, but this is insignificant. I will go much further on my own path. The work is the first line of my obituary. The work is the first line of my obituary.

quoted_message.text:
>The work is the first line of my obituary.

>我的事业会是我讣闻的开头。

text:
>The work is the first line of my obituary.

>我的事业会是我讣闻的开头。

"What do you live by?"

Translated by Claude:

I used to cope by thinking "if I die, my mom would have to travel across continents alone to collect my body - how pitiful." Now I cope by believing that "although I'm fragile and vulnerable, I trust that I am/want to become an adult who can fall down repeatedly but always get back up."

I've abandoned any illusions about the civility and decency of contemporary Europeans/Americans, and accepted the fact that in this global rightward shift, I will forever be a foreigner without a true homeland. I ignore those who ignore me, and destroy those who offend me. Standing on the remaining heights of globalism, I forever look down upon and pity their narrow and closed-off souls.

Meanwhile, more importantly, I create a spiritual homeland that can support me, ensuring that there I can be seen, heard, and engage in meaningful, deep conversations (for example: what works best for me is reading books, watching films, writing in my journal, and having dialogues with myself).

我 also 思 it's 天才。

此 is 非常良 idea。

A few days ago, I stayed indoors due to the extreme cold. Tonight, after class, I took the bus home. After getting off, I was listening to "到處留情" through my headphones, reaching that incredibly beautiful violin part while walking from the bus stop to my apartment. Snowflakes were drifting in the air, and the surrounding lights were dim. A girl walked past me from the opposite direction, head down and wrapped tightly in her down jacket. Suddenly, a feeling of emotional nostalgia welled up inside me. But there's no one I want to share this with anymore, no one I can share this with anymore.

A life goal of mine is to visit the Galápagos Islands to see penguins—those adorable creatures that drift from Antarctica along the Peruvian Current to Ecuador. I want to disconnect from my phone and the internet, lie on a serene beach, sit on a boat above crystal-clear waters, and journey through tropical jungles.


人生的阶段性目标是去加拉帕戈斯群岛看企鹅，去看秘鲁寒流下从南极洲漂流到厄尔瓜多的小可爱们，去那里丢掉手机和网络，躺在安安静静的海滩上，坐在透明海水之上的船只漂过热带丛林

On the last day of 2024, I sit in my apartment in Chicago, reflecting on my future and the main goals for the next two years. I've been thinking about key themes like Computer Graphics, Technical Artistry, Digital Media, and Creative Tools. Broadly, I want to pursue a field that blends technology and art to make a meaningful impact on people's daily lives.

I understand that reaching my goals will require a significant commitment of time and energy to mastering math, research, coding, and debugging. But if this is the field I am passionate about dedicating my life to, why not start now? If I don't try, I'll regret and will try it one day eventually. If I try, even if I fail, at least I’ll know I gave it my all.

This is the perfect age to explore, to discover what truly matters to me. As I’ve decided, for the next two years—and beyond—let’s just do it.
